etymologies: Middle English (in an earlier sense). From Anglo-Norman reneer, renaer, Anglo-Norman and Old French, renaier, Anglo-Norman and Old French, Middle French renier, reneier, renoier, Old French, Middle French regnoier to deny, abjure (one's faith, God, etc.) (900 as raneier), to disavow, renounce, deny, repudiate from post-classical Latin renegare

definitions: To deny the truth of (a statement). Also with clause as object.
